title: Don't Forget to Reinstall Periodically
body:
I did a full uninstall/reinstall the other day, and my LoL folder shrank from 14.5GB to 9GB.

The patcher is a cancer.

This has been a public service announcement.

Peace out.

replies.body: A good amount also comes from logs, which accumulate from use of the client, playing matches, etc. To keep your installation size down, you can also just delete your old logs periodically.
Or block them altogether if you look in GD I have made a guide how to do that.

I wouldn't recommend this, at least not altogether.
Recent logs are important, say ~2months worth.

I recently used my logs to determine if my latency was abnormal via logsoflag, it was a pretty useful tool, so keep it around.

You could had run cmd and typed: ping 203.174.139.185 to see if you will have net problems.
Also speedtest sites could also help you with that too. I would also have your ISP run a test on your line to see if there is a problem on the line of if it is your system.

Sure, but it doesn't really give you a baseline. It's good to recall previous games and see if you were experiencing packet loss as well.
Besides, collecting data from a 30minute connectivity session is a fucktonne of useful data :)

> [{quoted}](name=Wuks,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=EmzKAM7O,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2018-07-06T06:53:07.123+0000)
>
> A good amount also comes from logs, which accumulate from use of the client, playing matches, etc. To keep your installation size down, you can also just delete your old logs periodically.

I excluded that 1.7GB, it's 5.5GB of bad patching.
Dude, I have over 7.5TB of unused space. Not an issue for me.

I have just a little under 12TB free, but that doesn't mean anything. Most people run an SSD for their main drive with games on it, then HDD's for extra storage. SSD's don't come in those kind of sizes so a 5.5gb reduction still makes a big difference. Unless you're running your main drive on a HDD, which is nothing to be bragging about

SSDs have gotten a lot cheaper since I built my PC but certainly those kind of sizes are rather out of my price range for an SSD :P 

I have a 256 and a 480GB SSD in my RIG, the rest on HDD so I manage to fit all my games on the SSDs well enough, though I do have to clear out the bigger ones once I'm done with them since a lot of those AAA titles will run 30+ GBs, and some like ESO are almost 70.

My main drive is a 256GB SSD, but I've got 2 4TB HHDs that I put most of my stuff on (mainly where my games go). Personally, I don't really have any issues running my games from the HHD, the only exception to that being The Sims 3 (plus expansions), which just stutters for several seconds every few seconds if I'm not running it off the SSD (and giving it most of my 32GB RAM).
Holy mother of harddrives that's a lot of space. I have 4 and half a TB spare and thought that was heaps :O
